certificate_title: Aqeedah Foundations — Six Pillars of Belief

lessons.title: What is Īmān? Overview of the 6 Pillars
paragraphs: Īmān (faith) stands on six core pillars. If one pillar is denied, the whole structure falls. These pillars guide how a Muslim believes about Allah, unseen creation, revelation, guidance, the Afterlife, and decree.
You’ll meet each pillar simply and clearly, then test yourself with short quizzes designed to make you think.
refs: Overview adapted from traditional explanations of the pillars of Īmān.

quiz.q: How many pillars form the foundation of Īmān?
Denying one pillar of Īmān means…
Īmān means ______ in what Allah has informed and commanded.

lessons.title: Pillar 1 — Belief in Allah
paragraphs: Belief in Allah includes His Oneness in Lordship, worship, and His Names and Attributes. He has no partner in creating, sustaining, and governing; none share His right to be worshipped.
We affirm what Allah affirmed for Himself without distorting or denying.

quiz.q: Belief in Allah includes which of the following?
options: Oneness in Lordship, worship, and Names & Attributes

quiz.q: Which is closest to the meaning of tawḥīd?
We affirm Allah’s Names and ______ as He affirmed them.

lessons.title: Pillar 2 — Belief in the Angels
paragraphs: Angels are honoured servants created by Allah. They never disobey and carry out commands: delivering revelation, recording deeds, guarding, managing tasks such as rain, and bearing the Throne.
They are part of the unseen; we believe what Allah informed about them.

quiz.q: Which statement best describes angels?
options: Independent beings who can oppose Allah
Honoured servants who obey and carry out commands
Mythical symbols with no real existence

quiz.q: The angels who record deeds are called noble ______.

lessons.title: Pillar 3 — Belief in the Revealed Books
paragraphs: We believe in all scriptures Allah revealed to His messengers — those named to us and those unnamed. The Qur’an is Allah’s speech and is believed in with detailed submission.
Denying any scripture revealed by Allah is disbelief.

quiz.q: Belief in the Books means:
options: Only believing in the book sent to one’s own nation
Affirming all revealed scriptures, named and unnamed
Accepting the Qur’an but doubting earlier scriptures
Treating all religious books as human-only writings

quiz.q: Which is a named scripture mentioned in the Qur’an?
The Qur’an is the speech of ______.

lessons.title: Pillar 4 — Belief in the Messengers
paragraphs: We believe that all prophets and messengers sent by Allah are true, from the first to the last. They conveyed the message faithfully.
Disbelieving in one messenger is rejecting them all.

quiz.q: What happens if someone believes in some messengers but rejects others?
options: They have rejected the message as a whole
It doesn’t matter as long as they do good deeds

quiz.q: The messengers’ primary role was to:
options: Convey Allah’s guidance to their nations

quiz.q: We believe in all messengers from the ______ to the ______.

lessons.title: Pillar 5 — Belief in the Last Day
paragraphs: Belief in the Last Day includes everything that occurs after death: the grave and its questioning, resurrection, gathering, reckoning, the balance, the bridge, and the final abode in Paradise or Hell.
We accept what is authentically reported about these matters.
refs: Last Day topics summarized from classical sources

quiz.q: Which of the following belongs to belief in the Last Day?
options: Resurrection, reckoning, and final reward or punishment
Denial of any life after death

quiz.q: The scale upon which deeds are weighed is called the ______.
Yawm al-Qiyāmah literally refers to:

lessons.title: Pillar 6 — Belief in Pre-Decree (al-Qadar)
paragraphs: Everything that occurs — ease or hardship, life or death — is by Allah’s decree. Nothing happens by chance.
Four levels: Allah’s knowledge, His writing in the Preserved Tablet, His will, and His creation/bringing into existence.

quiz.q: Which set lists the four levels of belief in Qadar?
“No calamity befalls except it was written…” points to which level most clearly?
Nothing occurs without Allah’s ______ and Will.

lessons.title: How the Pillars Connect
paragraphs: The pillars interlink: belief in Allah grounds belief in the unseen world (angels) and revelation (books) delivered by messengers; these teachings prepare a person for the Last Day; all unfolds under Allah’s decree.
Seeing the connections strengthens certainty and practice.

quiz.q: Which best shows the link between pillars?
options: Books explain what angels revealed to messengers by Allah’s command
Messengers worship angels, then teach people
Angels judge everyone on the Last Day independently

quiz.q: Understanding connections between pillars strengthens our ______.

lessons.title: Final Review & Certificate
paragraphs: Final quick check of the six pillars. Pass this and you’ll complete the pathway. Your progress ring will animate from 98% to 100% and your certificate will unlock.

quiz.q: Choose the correct complete list of the six pillars:
options: Allah, Angels, Books, Messengers, Last Day, Pre-Decree
Allah, Prophets, Charity, Prayer, Hajj, Fasting
Allah, Angels, Saints, Imams, Last Day, Qadar
Allah, Books, Cities, Nations, Afterlife, Fate

quiz.q: Which statement is most accurate about the Books?
options: We believe only in the Qur’an
We believe in all Allah’s revealed scriptures, named and unnamed

quiz.q: Qadar means:
options: Everything happens by Allah’s knowledge, writing, will and creation
Only that good events are from Allah
